H0.text: Erosion is the gradual process that causes the shape of a riverbed to change over time.

H1.text: Dissolving is the gradual process that causes the shape of a riverbed to change over time.

H2.text: Plate shifting is the gradual process that causes the shape of a riverbed to change over time.

H3.text: Compaction is the gradual process that causes the shape of a riverbed to change over time.

A4.text: In all stages of stream erosion, by far the most erosion occurs during times of flood when more and faster-moving water is available to carry a larger sediment load.

A5.text: In the earliest stage of stream erosion, the erosive activity is dominantly vertical, the valleys have a typical V-shaped cross-section and the stream gradient is relatively steep.
